jobDescription: Position Description:As part of the DoD HPCMP CREATE Meshing and Geometry Team, your mission will be develop and apply novel computational workflows utilizing geometry-based finite element modeling for a range of engineering analyses and design scenarios.Must be able to demonstrate the ablility to understand physics-based modeling requirements and work closely with the development team in order to offer computational solutions to the user community.Must be able to identify gaps and needed improvements in geometric modeling and mesh generation capabilities to realize needed workflows.Required Qualifications: MS/PhD in Engineering, Physics or Applied MathematicsSolid background in mechanics and experience in one of more of the following domains: computational fluid dynamics, structural mechanics, fluid-structure interaction, structural acoustics, electromagnetics with application to radio-frequency antenna problemsExcellent written and oral communication skillsDesired Qualifications: Experience in developing and applying mesh generation algorithms to model large-scale, multi-disciplinary engineering simulationsUnderstanding modern object oriented programming principles using C++ and/or PythonExperience developing applications and tests using software development kits (SDK) and application programming interfaces (API)Ability to work in cross-platform environments (Linux, Windows and Mac)Clearance Requirement: This position requires a Secret security clearance, based on current background investigation.
